result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob D Wasek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter:  digital recorder -2:41
  Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Defendant in court with Attorney Murali S Jasti.  Emily Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not be at the Pizza Pit in Sun Prairie WI
- Defendant shall not be at The Marathon Gas Station in Sun Prairie WI
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant has been referred to the Drug Court Program
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
